alert.note: Alert for Jones (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 5:44AM EDT until April 07 at 4:18PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Falling Creek near East Juliette affecting Jones County. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, East Juliette, Dames Ferry, West Macon, Macon, Clinchfield, Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville, Hawkinsville, Echeconnee Creek at Houston Road near Byron, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast to continue. * WHERE...Falling Creek near East Juliette. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands and natural flood plain along the creek in the Piedmont National Wildlife Refuge upstream and downstream from the gage on Round Oak-Juliette Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 13 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.7 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 13 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
